articles.title: Australians Equally Distrust Both Trump and Xi, Survey Finds
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Australians are equally distrustful of both US President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping, according to a new survey, complicating Canberra’s task of managing ties with its key security ally and biggest trading partner.Most Read from BloombergShuttered NY College Has Alumni Fighting Over Its FutureAs Part of a $45 Billion Push, ICE Prepares for a Vast Expansion of Detention SpaceDo World’s Fairs Still Matter?NYC Renters Brace for Price Hikes After Broker-Fee BanAs Americ

articles.title: Warren Buffett Has $90 Billion Invested in These 9 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks. Here's the Best of the Bunch.
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway owns only two AI stocks.  The best Buffett AI stock should benefit tremendously as organizations build and deploy AI models in the cloud.  Warren Buffett readily admits that he doesn't understand artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Wedbush Reiterates $270 Target on Apple (AAPL), Citing Hopes for AI Execution
articles.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the 10 best tech stocks to buy according to billionaires right now. On June 10, following Apple’s keynote at the 2025 Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC), Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives reaffirmed his Outperform rating on the stock, along with a $270 price target. In his post-event note, Ives noted that while the […]

articles.title: 3 Reasons Why This Beaten-Down Growth Stock Could Trounce the S&P 500 in the Second Half of 2025
articles.content: Apple is a fair value for an industry-leading company.  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) is in the bottom 10% of S&P 500 stocks when measuring year-to-date performance.  Here are three reasons why the sell-off in Apple has gone far enough, and why the beaten-down growth stock could be a great buy for the second half of 2025.

articles.title: Here's How Many Shares of Apple Stock You Should Own to Get $1,000 in Yearly Dividends
articles.content: Apple renewed its dividend in 2012.  When people think about Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), products like the iPhone likely come to mind.  Apple has also become a reliable dividend payer since restarting payouts in 2012.

articles.title: Apple: WWDC 2025 Was A Major Point Of Failure
articles.content: Apple seems lost in a rapidly evolving market environment. Read how AAPL stock is struggling with long-term trends and repeated missteps like WWDC 2025.

articles.title: Week in Review: WWDC 2025 recap
articles.content: Welcome back to Week in Review! We have lots for you this week, including what came out of WWDC 2025; The Browser Company's AI browser; OpenAI's partnership with Mattel; and your iPad might finally be a true work machine.
